section.para: To view Inventory Availability by Item Group, select the "Inventory Availability by Item Group" option. The following screen will appear:
When displaying Inventory Availability by Item Group, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Select to display Inventory Availability for all Item Groups.
Specify Item Group whose Inventory Availability you want to display.
Enter an Item Group pattern to select a range of Item Groups. Refine your search using Regular Expressions.
Show Availability using one of the following criteria:
Select to show projected Availability based on the Lead Time specified in the Item Site master.
Select a number using the arrow buttons, or manually enter a value up to a maximum of 1000. Future Availability for the specified Item will be displayed based on the value entered here.
Display will show projected Inventory Availability as of date entered up to a maximum of 1000 days.
Display will show projected Inventory Availability for the date range entered.
Select to display Inventory Availability for all Sites.
Specify Site whose Inventory Availability you want to display.
Select to show Reorder Exceptions in display.
Select to ignore reorder at 0 in display.

Select to only show Inventory shortages in display. Shortages are always shown in the report, if they exist. However, using this option simply separates shortages out so you can see only them. A shortage exists if Availability is less than zero, as in

Display lists Inventory Availability by Item Group, using the specified parameters. If Planned Availability displays in the color orange, this means the actual or projected Quantity on Hand is at or below the Reorder Level. If the color is red, the current or projected Quantity on Hand is below 0.

note.para: When quantity appears in the "On Order" column, this refers to quantity that is on order through either a Work Order or Purchase Order. In the case of Purchase Orders, the quantity will always be represented in the Inventory Unit of Measure (UOM)â€”regardless of the Vendor UOM used on the Purchase Order.
